article.headline: Southern roars past Grambling State, 104-54
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Malcolm Miller pumped in 22 points as Southern humbled Grambling State, 104-54 Saturday night. The Jaguars roared to a 55-29 lead at the half and throttled back only a little in the second, closing with a 49-25 run. Miller connected on 8 of 11 shots from the field and was 6 of 9 from 3-point range while Southern shot 43 of 72 from the field as a team (59.7 percent). YonDarius Johnson scored 16 points and Calvin Godfrey, Javan Mitchell and Tre Lynch each scored 14 for Southern (13-10, 9-1 SWAC). Meanwhile, the Jaguars took advantage of 15 steals and pounced on 18 turnovers by the Tigers. Antwan Scott scored 11 points and Terry Rose added 10 to lead Grambling State (1-18, 0-10), which was just 18 of 53 from the field (34 percent) and 5 of 23 from long range.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
